text.text_translated: The Life of Pi tells the very special story of a boy named Pi. He is a teenager from India. His ship sinks in the Pacific Ocean. He is on a lifeboat and cannot leave. He is with a very dangerous tiger. The Canadian writer Yann Martel wrote the book. It is his third book. The book came out in 2001. It sold more than seven million copies all over the world. It won many prizes. People can read it in 41 different languages. Martel's father was a diplomat. A diplomat works for their country in other countries. When Martel was a child, he lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.
